safire.learning.interfaces.model_handle module¶

class safire.learning.interfaces.model_handle.AlternatingGibbsHandle[source]¶

Bases: safire.learning.interfaces.model_handle.ModelHandle

Runs an alternating Gibbs chain from a sampleable handle. The last step is a mean, all others are samples.

class safire.learning.interfaces.model_handle.BackwardModelHandle(model_instance, train, validate, test, run, heavy_debug=False)[source]¶

Bases: safire.learning.interfaces.model_handle.ModelHandle

Performs a backward pass on the model, instead of forward. Requires a sampleable model.

The run member of this handle will expect a hidden activation and will compute the visible activation for the given model.

classmethod clone(handle)[source]¶

Clones a BackwardModelHandle from an existing ModelHandle. We needed the dataset anyway to call model setup that created the first handle.

Parameters:handle (ModelHandle) – The model handle from which to take the model instance, train, validate and test functions. The run function is taken as well, but tucked away under a handle.get_hidden() member, since the “product” of this handle are not the hidden values.
init_backward_run(sample_visible=False)[source]¶

Creates the Theano function to compute the backward mean.

run(hidden, sample=False)[source]¶
class safire.learning.interfaces.model_handle.ModelHandle(model_instance, train, validate, test, run)[source]¶

Bases: object

Provides the train/validate/test handle for a learner class. This is, so far, just a wrapper for the model plus output of the ModelClass.setup() function.

A handle is the “runnable” interface to a model.

Also, it provides save/load functionality for model persistence.

classmethod load(filename)[source]¶

Loads handle from previously saved handle.

save(filename, protocol=-1)[source]¶

Saves the handle. Uses the _init_arg_snapshot() method of the model to save the model, attempts to save the theano functions directly.

class safire.learning.interfaces.model_handle.MultimodalClampedSamplerModelHandle(model_instance, train, validate, test, run, dim_text, dim_img, k=10)[source]¶

Bases: safire.learning.interfaces.model_handle.ModelHandle

This handle provides special run() functionality. Instead of using the run function given by a model’s setup, it will use a MultimodalClampedSampler to sample image one part of input values based on clamping the values of the other part.

To set up a clamped sampling handle:

>>> mdloader = MultimodalShardedDatasetLoader(root_orig, name_orig)
>>> multimodal_dataset = mdloader.load(text_infix, img_infix)
>>> handle = RestrictedBoltzmannMachine.setup(multimodal_dataset, n_out=1000)
>>>
>>> clamped_handle = MultimodalClampedSamplerModelHandle.clone(handle, multimodal_dataset)
>>>
>>> transformer = SafireTransformer(clamped_handle)

To run the handle: the text data can come from a different dataset, but bear in mind they need to share the same feature space.

>>> run_mdloader = MultimodalShardedDatasetLoader(root_run, name_run)
>>> text_dataset = run_mdloader.load_text(text_infix)
>>> text = text_dataset.test_X_batch(0, 1)
>>> img = clamped_handle.run(text)
classmethod clone(handle, dim_text, dim_img, **clamped_handle_kwargs)[source]¶

Clones a clamped sampling handle from the existing ModelHandle. We needed the dataset anyway to call model setup that created the first handle.

Parameters:handle (ModelHandle) – The model handle from which to take the model instance, train, validate and test functions. The run function is taken as well, but tucked away under a handle.get_hidden() member, since the “product” of this handle are not the hidden values.
run(text_features)[source]¶

Runs the sampler on text features input. Returns image representation.
